page.title: 13Warley Woods
page.content: Warley Woods is our local park. At one time a large house known as Warley Abbey stood in the park. It has a total{area of 48 ha.}of which 14 make up a{municipal golf course. It is a{landscaped}park with a small rose garden and flower beds near the site of the 'Abbey'. Some of the park is an{open, grassed area.}It is quite steep in places, and in winter we go {sledging.} There are{grey squirrels and many {birds}eg.wood pigeons,woodpeckers, ,magpies and chaffinches. There are{5000+ trees with some 3800 {deciduous}over 6m. mainly beech,some oak,sycamore,alder and sweet chestnut. There are about{300}yew,blue cedar and cypress trees. The smaller trees are birch,field maple,red oak and Norway maple. There are greenhouses for rearing plants for the park.
